alert.note: Alert for Baca County Including Springfield and Eastern Comanche Grasslands (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued March 03 at 4:12AM MST until March 03 at 8:00PM MST by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...A Red Flag Warning remains in effect from 12 PM through 8 PM MST today for gusty winds and low relative humidity for Fire Weather Zones 233...235...236...and 237 which includes eastern Las Animas, Bent, Prowers, and Baca Counties... ...A Fire Weather Watch remains in effect from Friday morning through Friday evening for gusty winds and low relative humidity for Fire Weather Zones 226...227...228...229...230...231...232 ...233...234...235...236...and 237 which includes all of the southeast plains... ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO 8 PM MST THIS EVENING FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONE 237... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY MORNING THROUGH FRIDAY EVENING FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONE 237... * Affected Area...Fire Weather Zone 237. * Winds...Today, south southeast 15 to 25 mph with gusts up to 35 mph. Friday, southwest 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 45 mph. * Relative Humidity...As low as 4 percent. * Impacts...Conditions will be favorable for rapid rates of fire growth and spread.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior. A Fire Weather Watch means that critical fire weather conditions are forecast to occur. Listen for later forecasts and possible Red Flag Warnings.

area.areaDesc: Baca County Including Springfield and Eastern Comanche Grasslands
